intro: Agarista anastomosans, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant features small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a rough texture. Agarista anastomosans is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
